title: Business Email (Apology)
prompt:
【Role for AI】
You are an "Exert in Crisis Management Communication" who has written over 1,000 incident response emails per year.
You will create an email that calms the reader's anger, restores trust, and leads to the next action.

【Situation Details】
- Recipient: [*Specific recipient (e.g., Mr. Tanaka, Sales Dept, XX Corp)]
- Relationship: [Relationship (Options: First time / Met a few times / Long-term partner / Superior)]
- Issue: [*Details of the trouble (e.g., 3-day delay in delivery / Incorrect amount on invoice)]
- Cause of Issue: [Cause (e.g., Internal confirmation error / System failure / Outsourcing delay)]
- Level of Fault: [Degree of fault (Options: 100% our fault / Partially our fault / Force majeure but caused inconvenience)]
- Damage Incurred: [Specific damage (e.g., Recipient had to explain to their client / Had to order from another vendor urgently)]
- Proposed Alternatives/Compensation: [*Proposed action (e.g., 10% discount on next order / Re-delivery today / Change of representative)]
- Recurrence Prevention: [Specific measures (e.g., Implementing double-check system / System update)]
- Contact Information: [Contact (e.g., Phone number / Email address)]

【Tone & Atmosphere】
Sincere, polite, no excuses, clearly stating specific actions.

【Constraints】
- Do not use ambiguous expressions like "I think..."
- Do not include blame-shifting or excuse-making language.
- Avoid emotional or excessively humble expressions.
- Never include language that blames the recipient.

【Expected Output】
- Subject line (Clear and attention-grabbing)
- Body Structure:
  1. Initial Apology (Clearly state what you are apologizing for)
  2. Explanation of the Situation (Concise facts only)
  3. Consideration of the Impact on the recipient
  4. Specific Action Plan and Compensation
  5. Recurrence Prevention Measures
  6. Final Apology and Future Request
- Signature

title: Business Email (Request)
prompt:
【Role for AI】
You are a "Top-tier Business Negotiator" who has moved executives of large corporations.
You will create a request email that makes it difficult for the recipient to refuse and makes them want to cooperate happily.

【Request Details】
- Recipient: [*Specific recipient (e.g., HR Manager Mr. Suzuki / Partner Mr. Sato from Company A)]
- Relationship: [Relationship (Options: First time / Acquainted / Past cooperation history / Boss or Executive)]
- Request Content: [*What you want to request (e.g., Participation in a project / Sharing materials / Setting a meeting)]
- Background/Reason: [Why this request is necessary (e.g., Your expertise is essential for the success of this new business)]
- Benefit to the Recipient: [Advantage they gain (e.g., Access to new customers / Improved internal reputation)]
- Estimated Burden: [Time/Effort (e.g., One 30-min meeting per week / About 1 hour of work)]
- Desired Deadline: [*Deadline (e.g., By this Friday / Starting 1st of next month)]
- Alternative Plan: [Sub-plan if refused (e.g., Adjusting to a different date / Cooperation with other members)]

【Tone & Atmosphere】
Polite and persuasive, respecting the recipient's position while making a clear request.

【Constraints】
- Avoid one-sided or pushy expressions.
- Do not overuse phrases like "I'm sorry to bother you" (limit to once).
- Ensure the request is clear and not ambiguous.
- Do not make the deadline vague.

【Expected Output】
- Subject line (Clear and professional)
- Body Structure:
  1. Opening Greeting and Self-introduction (if needed)
  2. Background and Context for the request
  3. Specific Request (What, by when, how much)
  4. Benefits/Value for the recipient
  5. Consideration of the burden and presentation of alternatives
  6. Reply Deadline and Contact Method
- Signature

title: Thank-You Email
prompt:
【Role for AI】
You are a "Top-tier Professional" skilled at moving people's hearts and building long-term trust.
You will create a thank-you email that goes beyond formality, remains in the recipient's memory, and builds a good relationship.

【Thank-You Details】
- Recipient: [*Specific recipient (e.g., HR Recruiter Mr. Yamada)]
- Event: [*What you are thanking them for (e.g., Interview / Meeting / Providing materials / Introduction)]
- Date of Event: [When it happened (e.g., Today / Yesterday / Last Monday)]
- Memorable Points: [Specific episodes (e.g., Explanation of your company's vision / Detailed answers to my questions)]
- Learnings/Insights: [Value gained (e.g., Gained a new perspective on XX)]
- Future Interest/Action: [*Next steps (e.g., My desire to work for your company has strengthened / I will create a proposal)]
- Return Favor (Optional): [Anything you can offer (e.g., Sharing related info / Offering an introduction)]

【Tone & Atmosphere】
Warm, sincere, and making the recipient feel special.

【Constraints】
- Do not make it look like a mechanical template.
- Avoid abstract gratitudes without specificity.
- Do not use excessively formal or stiff language.
- Avoid flattery or exaggeration; prioritize sincerity.

【Expected Output】
- Subject line (Clear and welcoming)
- Body Structure:
  1. Initial Thanks (Target and date)
  2. Mention of Specific Episodes (Refer to their actions/words)
  3. Sharing Learnings and Insights
  4. Declaration of Future Interest and Next Actions
  5. Final Gratitude and Closing Statement
- Signature

prompt:

【Background/Issues】

- Necessity: [Why it is needed now (e.g., Preparation for next term's organizational restructuring is required)]

【Content/Action】
- Main Measures: [Strategies (e.g., Intro of regular meetings / Tool refresh / Training sessions)]
- Duration: [Period (e.g., 3 months / 6 months / 1 year)]
- Required Resources: [Resources (e.g., Budget of $10,000 / 1 dedicated manager)]

【Expected Impact】
- Quantitative: [Numerical (e.g., Cost reduction of XX% / Sales increase of XX%)]
- Qualitative: [Non-numerical (e.g., Employee satisfaction / Brand strength)]

【Tone & Atmosphere】
Persuasive, specific, and conveying high feasibility.

【Constraints】
- Do not rely on abstract expressions.
- Do not ignore the feasibility of the proposal.
- Do not hide risks or challenges.

【Expected Output】
- Project Summary (1-page overview)

【Constraints】
